html: One of the gravest transgressions with which the servant confronts Jehovah’s people (v 1 ) is their desecration of the Sabbath. Even Sabbath meetings aren’t acceptable when they don’t spring from personal righteousness: “As for convening meetings at the New Month and on the Sabbath, wickedness with the solemn gathering I cannot approve” (Isaiah 1:13 ). What characterizes Jehovah’s servants is that they keep the Sabbath Day holy (Isaiah 56:6 ). As a “sign” between Jehovah and his people (Exodus 31:13; Ezekiel 20:12, 20 ), Sabbath observance is a sure indicator of their loyalty to his covenant.
